document.title: English Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools March 2024

60A0C05EE5204AC58C72A8C8693F47BE.description:
Avoid plagiarism and give proper credit by providing citations whenever using another
person’s media, facts, ideas, graphics, music, and direct quotations.

069F7525AB88485FBC4B22554F3F2453.description: Organize and share information orally, in writing, or through visual display.

ECBE0D499990461B870D5AD77DE9537A.description:
Develop notes that include important concepts, summaries, and identification of
information sources.

09ABC162B1894DC6B851DD0580E1EDF6.description:
Organize and synthesize information from the print and digital resources, evaluating their
relevance, reliability, and credibility.

B4BFD52B7E4B42EC85800AB265C89C56.description:
Identify search terms to locate information and gather relevant information from various
print and digital sources to address the research.

BFE60E635D5A4983B141E3B89467486D.description:
Formulate questions that help narrow the topic and revise questions as needed based on
research.

12029792B3984DD588FFDD925F0BB3FD.description:
The student will conduct research and read a series of conceptually related texts on
selected topics to build knowledge on grade-five content and texts, solve problems, and
support cross-curricular learning.

E2BF93B883B04180AAF6D50C7534FAFC.description:
Compare and contrast techniques used in a variety of media messages (e.g., animation,
famous images and words, music and sound, photo-editing).

53F21FE02BA04DEDACC183F725C48018.description:
Identify the purpose, intended audience, and credibility of information (e.g., auditory,
visual, and written media messages) being presented.

885AF5980AC94143A735156ECC1BFC47.description:
Deconstruct various types of media to identify the characteristics and determine the
effectiveness of the intended messages.

09084EFA392F426C98CC5DEBF01905DC.description:
Strategically use two or more interdependent modes of communication to convey the
intended message and enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

3A746D2128BC46A1A55DC52D0D753EC0.description:
Select, organize, and create engaging presentations that include multimedia components
and visual displays.

A6AB645EFCE24928A11734159431F415.description:
Encouraging audience participation through planned interactions (e.g., questioning,
discussion, gathering responses, and movement).

A877F79AC4934861977C121ABCFAC546.description:
Demonstrating awareness of and sensitivity to the appropriate use of words (e.g.,
avoiding stereotypes, multiple meanings of words).

72300A2257404FDB9B59B89F2C4F1D08.description:
Using facial expressions and gestures to support, accentuate, or dramatize the
message during oral presentations.

643E46A6B7FF47DEA6D4B9CC177B8962.description:
Demonstrating appropriate speaking techniques (e.g., adequate volume and clear
pronunciation) suitable to the audience, purpose, and situations.

71682B140170475FBF0FDF8960CDA315.description:
Using content specific vocabulary, appropriate fact,s and relevant descriptive details
to support themes or central ideas.

F0BA8D0FB0D245C6A75D0BE0000415AB.description:
Report orally on a topic or text or present an opinion in an organized manner. This
includes:

FCC3C394F40F4C3EA2277540FA996A62.description: Share responsibility for the learning based on assigned roles and/or task expectations.

4B818E84264A4BDA99E79319AB5C6CC5.description:
Summarizing the main ideas being discussed, using evidence, examples, and details
to support opinions and conclusions.

62A971878F2B4FFBB7137D158D1E6F64.description:
Asking and answering relevant questions to build on others’ ideas, clarify ideas, and
acquire or confirm information.

5A94CB35039543C2AD6ADE5416F1B9C3.description: Respectfully demonstrating agreement or disagreement with others’ ideas.

546B7C7B7D294FECB4AA9916FEF19451.description: Listening actively and speaking using agreed-upon discussion rules.

F33EE24CB8B3458A81B4C053CF9878B5.description:
Prepare for and participate in a range of sustained collaborative discussions with diverse
partners on grade five topics and texts. This includes:

E52DC8635F54450E860914497CF63DC7.description:
The student will develop effective oral communication and collaboration skills to build a
community of learners that process, understand, and interpret content together.

7B6C3C671E1742C8B53E319030B576D2.description: Consult reference materials to check and correct spelling.

AB1BED7C2A7F48F6983F37F3713C4D5C.description:
Use spelling patterns and generalizations (e.g., word families, syllable patterns, ending
rules) when pronouncing and writing words.

7486AE23D929462BA81D3B782397181A.description: Use a hyphen to divide words at the end of a line in writing.

BC25CD5C096E4080A48496E4FAA4ADF5.description: Use colons to separate hours and minutes and to introduce a list.

834489D98CFC4011A7917D0198E5547C.description: Use commas correctly in compound sentences.

4561E780327D4E1AAD0D0BB65C0C94AB.description: Use standard subject-verb agreement when speaking and writing.

8D39068282564C959828F7ABE1709776.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb tense and number in writing.

86F28C2C19D943A29170F1F44313A5FA.description:
Use interjections, prepositional phrases, and coordinating and subordinating conjunctions
in writing to join words and phrases in a sentence.

3A667CDC892041D095450570EFD0738E.description:
Use adverbs to express time, frequency, degree, and level of certainty when speaking and
writing.

360DCC3D078B4CC4B2BA9850D192B69D.description: Expand, combine, and reduce sentences for meaning, reader/listener interest, and style.

94D08FA692DA475D9A8065B74255D4E2.description:
The student will use the conventions of Standard English when speaking and writing,
differentiating between contexts that call for formal English and situations where informal
discourse is more appropriate.

0080B06F9AD6424AB686563A1959A69F.description:
Self-and peer-edit the writing for capitalization, spelling, punctuation, sentence structures,
paragraphing, and Standard English (See Language Usage for grade level expectations).

24FA6B1106A54067BD38A51F68DAD31C.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as
needed by revising for quality of ideas, organization, sentence fluency, and precise word
choice.

AD6E961AD87D4392A207F61C5D70092C.description: Providing a concluding statement or section.

F88491AB790F4D61B9712B911D97EA1E.description:
Using transition words and prepositional phrases for sentence variety and link one
sentence and paragraph to another.

AFE2F2014A514C1691E8E10E4C721E75.description:
Developing, selecting, and organizing ideas relevant to topic, purpose, and genre, using
precise and descriptive language and tone-specific vocabulary to enhance the central
idea, tone, and voice.

D6E0B6BE90EB4CECAE7F924D4180B0FB.description:
Introducing a clear topic sentence and logically organizing ideas and factual evidence
to support the position in persuasive writing.

24D635DD478E4FAAA28900081833B15F.description: Engage in writing as a process to compose well-developed paragraphs. This includes:

E0B5200E6E614E79B74BD0BD9F4B3588.description:
Write in response to texts read (including summaries, reflections, and descriptions) in
which students demonstrate their thinking with details, examples, and other evidence from
the text that are logically grouped.

28E0B26A3E5F453C86B34037937B356C.description:
Write persuasive pieces on topics or texts, including media messages, supporting a clear
perspective with adequate facts, reasons, and logically grouped information.

E483678E50C3481BA2F08361C7ABDCB9.description:
Write expository texts to examine a topic and convey ideas that develop the focus with
relevant facts, concrete details, and examples from multiple sources and are grouped
logically.

7CAE2F72A3DC4F178AC8C80D11B4CA70.description:
Write personal or fictional narratives in prose or poetic form that organize the writing
around a central problem, conflict, or experience using descriptions or dialogue to develop
the experience(s).

F3CFF26027BC47B2AA1CACE013D7E984.description:
The student will compose various works for diverse audiences and purposes, linked to
grade five content and texts.

F8A29E498EB24321811A61FB24E73020.description:
Use phoneme-grapheme (sound/symbol) correspondences to decode (read) and encode
(spell) grade-level high-frequency words with automaticity and accuracy.

3CC4516555EF4EDB828CB8BF9B2C13A2.description:
Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and
morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to spell accurately.

C5D94E2BA83444588240717702C6E18C.description:
The student will print legibly in manuscript and cursive while applying grade level
word knowledge to spell words correctly.

C0E49239768349E79C2425E2B3626EA8.description:
Explain the relationships or interactions between two or more individuals, events,
procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical texts, including what
happened and why based on specific information in the text.

B123CA1E50D8445390503A6903F01F79.description:
Analyze multiple accounts of the same event or topic, noting important similarities and
differences in the point of view they represent.

6D2DDE20008042E6AE5A14E1A54D3827.description: Use prior (experience) and background (content) knowledge as context for new learning.

14B663557ED14797B4847972BE205E26.description:
Determine the author’s purpose(s) and describe how the author’s perspective (e.g., beliefs,
assumptions, biases) influences the meaning of the text.

E92AAE04D13F4009A3F84FB867A81F08.description:
Examine text features and search tools in multiple print and digital sources to evaluate and
gain meaning from the information found.

7A2156C92E8B479EB652DC51E5631709.description:
Describe the overall organization patterns of texts (e.g., cause/effect, comparison/contrast,
problem/solution, description, sequence, and chronological) and how each successive part
builds on earlier sections, using available transitional words and phrases.

3D6A90D2D3264352ACCA646C0822CEA8.description:
Describe how an author uses reasons, evidence, and opinions to support points in a text, by
identifying (and accurately quoting) which reasons and evidence support which point(s).

FD3ACEC63949480BAF91382923922DDF.description:
Summarize events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in historical, scientific, or technical texts,
including what happened, how, and why.

D66E44EBA06549F38CEE9215BD23580C.description:
Summarize the main ideas of texts and specific paragraphs within them, including how
they are developed through the details.

2690BA9E78094D2BAAE11E936B93FC26.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from grade-level complex informational texts read.

6C34AEFC9FA54C2B8EAA36B544EEA4DB.description:
Compare and contrast details in paired literary and informational nonfiction texts including
their treatment of similar themes, topics, and patterns of events.

43E048BEFB54403EBB62C9BC6BAE54B8.description:
Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including
the difference between first-and third-person narratives.

165EFD4F94234DB5AD5CFF0BB35FE847.description:
Set a purpose for reading by activating prior (experience) and background (content)
knowledge.

C6D18975B4FF4E17B4B086496E67D4A8.description:
Analyze how the characteristics of a poem and the author’s use of patterns of sound (e.g.,
rhyme, rhythm, alliteration, consonance) impact meaning.

33F9DF909E3C40E99F6AA5C6D5F44400.description:
Analyze the author’s use of language (e.g., synonyms, figurative language, sensory words,
dialogue, dialect) and their impact on understanding characters, setting, and plot events.

F15EFED1557D433F94E37CC03D0B2897.description:
Describe how an author develops a character through what characters say, think, do, and
how other characters respond.

0ECCF462C50B4FABB179D35055E370C3.description:
Explain how events from the plot cause the character(s) to change or evolve and how the
development of character(s) or settings impact the plot.

36AA2215F99B49DD8D0F43CE015CE6BA.description:
Describe plots in stories as a sequence of events that develops the central conflict and
resolution, including initiating events, climax, and resolution.

10C32BB79C0445A3944A8E6048C5D190.description:
Summarize the story or play, including the overarching theme and lessons learned, and
explain how they are developed or conveyed through specific details.

AB22659F621042C1BAE1BEC8C369246B.description:
The student will use textual evidence to demonstrate comprehension and build
knowledge from a variety of grade-level complex literary texts read to include poetry,
fantasy, humor, mystery, adventure, realistic fiction, historical fiction, and folklore/tall tales,
with a focus on fantasy.

0C653AD5D84A463AAF71245D794031BA.description: Use newly learned words and phrases in discussions and speaking activities.

9DA976E615094342881BD9568566E8D6.description:
Use glossaries, beginning dictionaries, and thesauruses, both print and digital, to determine
or clarify the meaning of words and phrases.

A2D4A0C6E886449795D5800B668F4BBF.description: Use strategies to infer word meanings.

EFB50A7B789E4536AC38CBFD91DC5AE7.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs and adjectives.

AD41123CEB314774872EF734BBA4C499.description:
Develop breadth of vocabulary knowledge by listening to and reading high quality,
complex text.

00BDB11198814252B2144B443FC901CB.description:
Analyze the morphological relationships between words, including how Greek and Latin
affixes and roots impact the meaning.

13CEB63B964849FCADED9B71FF645F50.description:
Apply knowledge of grade-level appropriate synonyms and antonyms to better understand
each word.

4702BE846AA34004B9B063860F933DCD.description: Use the context of a sentence to apply knowledge of homophones.

84A8CB4E257E431B80E1A135E98C859B.description:
Determine the meaning of complex words using frequently occurring root words and
inflectional affixes (e.g., -s, -ing,-ed).

C67E6535D15644D7BD32C764A5333548.description:
Discuss meanings of complex words and phrases acquired through conversations and
literature.

106D70E471F443BF93E23293D236964E.description:
Develop general academic language and content specific vocabulary by listening to,
reading, and discussing a variety of grade-five texts and topics.

4B38B141D21246CCB4B38F6C026F56D6.description: The student will systematically build vocabulary and word knowledge based on gradefive content and texts.

449631350D584DBC8B5588B58385F556.description:
Use reading strategies as needed to aid and monitor comprehension when encountering
challenging sections of text. These sense-making strategies attend to common
organizational text structures, summarizing, asking questions of the text, and others
(Reading Strategies 3-12).

849BDBAD6A634271B17C4B11075B6709.description:
Regularly engage in reading a series of conceptually related texts organized around topics
of study to build knowledge and vocabulary (These texts should be at a range of
complexity levels so students can read the texts independently, with peers, or with modest
support.). Use this background knowledge as context for new learning (Deep Reading on
Topics to Build Knowledge and Vocabulary K-12).

8C788ABF03BF41FF8C33DA85D84F722A.description:
When responding to text through discussions and/or writing, draw several pieces of
evidence from grade-level complex texts to support claims, conclusions, and inferences
from texts, including quoting or paraphrasing accurately and tracing where relevant
evidence is located (Textual Evidence, K-12).

2ADEC6EF7D12406087EF1850EE65D90C.description:
Proficiently read and comprehend a variety of literary and informational texts that exhibit
complexity at the higher range of the grades 4-5 band (See the Quantitative and Qualitative
Analysis charts for determining complexity in the Appendix.) (Text Complexity, 2-12).

C646A744DF41474B842A245C8CD389DD.description:
Read a variety of grade-level complex texts with accuracy, automaticity, appropriate rate,
and meaningful expression in successive readings to support comprehension. Monitor
while reading to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, as necessary
(Reading Fluency, K-12).

E5FEF104817E4CC3854A48F60D13DA6F.description:
The student will build knowledge and comprehension skills from reading a range of
challenging, content-rich texts. This includes fluently reading and gathering evidence from
grade-level complex texts, reading widely on topics to gain purposeful knowledge and
vocabulary, and using reading strategies when comprehension breaks down.

6726286ED5D347FE975A0260F433D3F8.description: Developing Skilled Readers and Building Reading Stamina

A1A834A0559B401B90612BC1AA3247B1.description:
Read grade-level high-frequency words, including decodable and irregular words, with
automaticity and accuracy.

E4BA87B09AD243CB9854E9EF097B6666.description: Use knowledge of morphology (suffixes, prefixes, root/base) to decode words.

4FB2BB4AC3C14A3985DE361EB2F1D8C0.description: Use knowledge of syllabication and syllable types to decode and encode words.

A7FB8271DEA3421194BC4B495BAD9D65.description:
Phonics and Word Analysis: The student will apply grade level phonics and word
analysis skills to decode (read) unfamiliar words in grade level text.

83D5C442AFE84AD9B9444BEFAFF6F58E.description:
See Kindergarten through grade two for standards that address Phonological and
Phonemic Awareness.

2A1707FE517646E8B0AA740B33EA300B.description: See Kindergarten for standards that address Print Concepts.
